page.title: 06Childrens' Games
page.content: Following a classroom survey of out-door games, a long list of games was compiled. On closer inspection it was soon revealed that most of these were just variations of traditional games. The game 'It'was decribed as '60 in', 'torture', 'monsters'. British Bulldog was popular as were many other chasing games. Spinning tops and hoops were no longer popular although some girls still skipped. Individuals played with a football or roller skates and many children used their bicycles a lot . {British Bulldogs.}This game is played with one person chosen to be it.The rest of the group line up against a fence or wall. The person chosen calls out a name and this is a signal for that person to run across. If he or she
